intro: Stemonacanthus formosus, commonly known as the Taiwan star-flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Taiwan. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features opposite leaves with serrated margins and a compact growth habit. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural gardens.
